column1: Q1 How engaged do you feel with your coursework and academic activities?
Q2 How likely are you to feel that you receive the support you need to succeed in your coursework and academic activities?
Q3 How likely are you to feel supported by your faculty and peers in the program?
Q4 How would you rate the program's inclusivity and sense of belonging?
Q5 How would you rate your access to health and wellness resources?
Q6 How often do you feel supported in publishing scholarly works or presenting your work in conferences?
Q7 How likely are you to feel supported in developing scholarly practices in this program?
Q8 How satisfied are you with your academic success within the program?
Q9 How prepared do you feel for the workforce or further education as a result of the program?
Q10 How manageable do you find the time-to-degree requirements and expectations?
Q11 How satisfied are you with the availability of financial aid, scholarships, or assistantships?
Q12 How would you rate your access to faculty mentorship and guidance throughout the program?
Q13 How often do you feel included in departmental decision-making or activities?
Q14 How would you rate the balance between academic workload and personal life?
Q15 How frequently do you face challenges that affect the time it takes to complete your degree requirements?
Q16 How well does the program's curriculum align with workforce preparation or further graduate education?
Q17 How would you rate the academic rigor of the program's curriculum?
Q18 How would you rate the level of engagement the curriculum fosters among students?
Q19 How likely are you to suggest changes to the required coursework in the program?
Q20 How well do the graduate courses prepare you for comprehensive exams?
Q21 How likely are you to suggest expanding the variety of elective courses offered in the program?
Q22 How relevant do you find the course content to your career or academic goals?
Q23 How often do you feel that coursework assignments and assessments reflect real-world applications in your field?
Q24 How effectively does the program foster collaboration and networking opportunities?
Q25 How satisfied are you with the opportunities for internships, practicums, or other hands-on experiences?
Q1 How satisfied were you with the overall quality of the graduate program?
Q2 How well did the program meet your academic expectations?
Q3 How would you rate the faculty support and mentorship you received during your time in the program?
Q4 How satisfied were you with the research opportunities provided during your time in the program?
Q5 How satisfied were you with the teaching opportunities provided during your time in the program?
Q6 How would you rate the sense of community among students and faculty during your studies?
Q7 How well did the program support your mental health and well-being?
Q8 How well did the program prepare you for your current career or further academic pursuits?
Q9 How relevant was the curriculum to your professional or academic goals after graduation?
Q10 How useful were the skills you developed in the program for your current job or academic work?
Q11 Did the program provide adequate networking opportunities for you to connect with professionals in your field?
Q12 How well did the program prepare you for real-world applications in your field?
Q13 How likely are you to recommend this program to someone considering graduate studies in economics?
Q14 How would you rate the academic rigor of the program's coursework in preparing you for your post-graduate endeavors?
Q15 How well did the program's curriculum align with the skills and knowledge needed for your current career or studies?
Q16 How satisfied were you with the opportunities for interdisciplinary studies or collaboration with other departments?
